content.question: A parallel-plate capacitor is fully charged by a battery of voltage <math alttext="V " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and then isolated. The magnitude of the charge on each plate is <math alttext="Q " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the energy stored in the capacitor is <math alttext="U" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. A piece of material with dielectric constant <math alttext="kappa equals 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Îº</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is inserted between the plates of the capacitor, as shown. skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
